name: Bali Farm House
address: Jl. Raya Singaraja-Denpasar, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia
review 1: Bali farm house was such an amazing time. The staff were beyond pleasant and helpful. The landscape was breathtaking and very picturesque. I got to pet and feed most of the animals which they all enjoyed thoroughly. I also had a chance to enjoy a meal at their restaurant and it was just as amazing. I recommend Bali Farm House!
review 2:
The place was incredible, and the nature was so vibrant and refreshing. Amazing place to visit, meticulous gardens with places to relax and admire nature. Also you can see, play, feeding their cute animals (Alpaca, Donkey, Pony, etc).
The Barn restaurant was amazing, food very tasty and friendly staffs. Fresh for your enjoyment.
review 3: Lovely scenery, fresh air, some cute animals...... you can feed them by buying some food for them and take some pictures inside..... the restaurant is great...... You can trade your coupon there to get discount for your meals and beverages. I think this will be one of crowded destination in 1-2 years ahead. Some spot are still in progress, good environment, good concept, but takes time to make it fully equipped. Well doneüôèüèª‚ò∫Ô∏è
review 4:
When our guide suggested going to Bali Farm House I was a little hesitant as were on a budget and typically these places cost a lot. But I'm glad to be proven wrong in this case.
We got the family ticket for 2 adults and 2 children which included 200k worth food and beverage voucher. (50k per person). Price definitely worth it!
Our young children were delighted to be this close to farm animals which we have only ever read about before. Ponies, donkeys and alpacas. Then we even met some Australian Emus (a truely special experience for my children who are half Australian by blood but born in Bali). Ostriches, silky chickens and geese were other fun fowl on the farm.
They're building a playground which looks like it will be amazing fun when it's open.
My daughter wanted to ride a pony but unfortunately we got in too late and the pony had already been put away to rest for the afternoon. So if you want a pony ride make sure you ask for that first before feeding time.
The highlight of our visit was our up close and personal with the goats and bunnies. We got a bucket of food each for my children to hand feed the animals (50k for these 2 animals). Truly a most delightful and unforgettable experience in Bali Farm House. The joy and giggles are worth every moment.
review 5:
Our visit to Bali Farm was absolutely fantastic! From the moment we stepped onto the grounds, we were surrounded by stunning landscapes that took our breath away. It's truly a nature lover's paradise!

One of the highlights of our visit was the opportunity to interact with the animals. Feeding the alpacas, rabbits, horses, and ponies was an unforgettable experience for both kids and teenagers alike. The animals were friendly and well-cared for, which made the experience even more enjoyable.

The staff (especially Padma) were incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about their work. They were always on hand to answer any questions we had and went above and beyond to ensure that we had a memorable visit.

Overall, we had an amazing time at and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun day out in nature. Whether you're a family with kids or a group of friends, there's something for everyone to enjoy here. We can't wait to visit again soon!

name: Taman Denbukit Camping Ground
address: Desa Bedugul, Jl. Sugriwa Dasong Pancasari, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia
review 1:
-Closed access from the  main road
road still rocky to the location
-Spacious parking area
-Quite a lot of bathroom and toilets
warm water is available, have to wait.
review 2: Nice view and place for camping or gathering, minus for toilet cleanliness
review 3:
Nice camping site, big area, tents available to rent, glamping as well.
Beautiful scenery, clean and relaxing.
It is very cold during the night, get extra blanket üòÅ
review 4: Lovely stay. Great hosts. The property is at a good location, very near to ulun danu beratan temple and iconic handara gate. They have all the facilities. Their bungalows are amazing with attached toilet bathroom. Definitely recommend staying here!! 10/10
review 5: Good for gathering event, near to main road and business center, the view also good. There are some type of tent or cabin that you can rent, the staff also kind, and there is a hot tub. But unfortunately, when we buy the firewood, it's still wet so it's difficult to be burned. There are some instagramable spot there.  And i suggest you to prepare for the temperature at the night

name: Wisma Nangun Kerti Bedugul
address: Jl. Pancasari - Baturiti, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia
review 1: This place has a good view. It is surrounded by mountains. Bring a thick jacket to stay warm because the place is very cold. Everything is good but they don't provide hot water to all rooms :)
review 2:
1.Nice place to spend time with friend, family, and beloved person.
2.Nice camping ground include bonefire, tent, bathroom.
3. Large parking for car and motocycle, bus parking are not avaliable (you must walk from road around 200 meter's from main lobby)
review 3: Decent and good place for staying with large group. Stayed here back in May 2012 along with school group during the end of 9th grade junior high school and slept in one of the two bungalows. Dining room and ballroom are on the second floor and they are clean. There's also a large camping area as well as a small chapel at the back of this property. Not to mention the air is cool here. It's also close to Buyan Lake.
review 4: Good place for chilling out with your family, classmates, officemate. They also provide tends with matras and they have a big yard. You can request for campfire to held campfire party. About the weather, Fresh air in the day time and fog during the evening. Recomended.
review 5: Great accomodation for big groups. I came here for my capoeira events and the place is big and cold but convenient and have amazing view. You can spot small chapel at the back of this place.

name: Alamu Eco Lodge
address: Jl. Wisata Alam Danau Buyan, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81152, Indonesia
review 1: Got a family camping night here and it was fun! Super comfy for those who bring their baby closer to the nature.  The view from our tent is amazing, they serve delicious and surprisingly affordable food, they provide BBQ packages as well.
review 2: Had my chill and relax for few hours here to enjoy their foods and drink at Alamu cafe. Staff friendly, foods and drinks super tasty. We will be back again next time.
review 3:
I got to spend my weekend at Alamu, and I had an incredible experience. The tent are very comfortable and provided enough privacy. The place is clean and relaxing.. my kid can safely play around in the nature which is great.
The only problem was some flies that could get into your tent if you didn‚Äôt zip up the mesh layer (but that was on me haha)
Friendly staff and decent food. Overall, it was an amazing experience and we‚Äôd love to come back again one day! ‚ù§Ô∏è
review 4: The room is quite clean, but the things I really worried is the mold in the tent. Its not good, but I can understand!
review 5:
It was cold at night and the blanket was small size.
In the morning it was too hot:))
Also the room is really small. Not for a long stay.
And road with loud bikes are really close.

Great breakfast included.
Nice stuff and low prices.
Beautiful view.

name: Alam Buyan Cafe
address: Jl. Wisata Alam Danau Buyan, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81152, Indonesia
review 1:
If you are wondering around Bedugul this place is amazingly Recommended. we book this accommodations that look like a camp but it‚Äôs actually a very cozy warm and clean tend it‚Äôs better than hotel room :) And we get a nice hill and farm view.
the Cafe Upfront is also cool, we order some hot pot and just nyam nyam while enjoying the nature surounding and the warmest of the soup broth.
good job for the management, can‚Äôt wait for the next visit
review 2:
Nice hidden gem 300m away from the main road. Worth visiting for a drink, snack or meal!

The sandwich was amazing: tender chicken, crunchy fresh paprika and tomato, fried egg, perfect toast (still soft inside), and a large portion size, served with potato wedges which were also delicious. üòç

Strawberry juice was good as well, not overly sweet, a good mix with the ice and again a large portion size. üëç

And then all menu options are very affordable in my opinion. üëè

The view is mountain-side, not lake-side but it's still a nice view I think.
review 3: This place really comfy to chill and enjoy the mountain air with ice coffee that is pretty good
review 4: Strawberry juice here is a must every time you visit Alamu Cafe, you can taste the freshly picked strawberries. Great service, friendly staffs, lovely interior. Would recommend to visit
review 5: Really nice place! Beautiful atmosphere and good food, especially drinks here is awesome. Highly recommend

name: The Buyan Villas Resort
address: Q43X+HQ4, Jl. Raya Bedugul, Pancasari, Singaraja, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81162, Indonesia
review 1:
The gardens and the open fire place  are the 2 positive things,  but it stops right there. The property is in desperate need of an upgrade, so many maintenance issues to many to list actually. The place is totally outdated, no wifi, hot tub, food, cleaning of the room. Constant noise from the road below.
The kitchen equipment is old and dirty, oven,stove, fridge all not working properly.
The Matress smells like Urin, carpet not cleaned in 30 years by the looks of it.
It is a shame as this place could really have potential, but will definitely never see us again.
review 2: Good views here. Large middle area with fireplace, kitchennete and chairs between each room. Can sit on the terrace and enjoy views. Green garden. Very dated. Kitchennete dirty and supplies not complete. Mattresses lumpy. Bathroom needs repair and renovation. But good place for children to run and play. Great view of Lake.
review 3: The villa was actually good but lack of maintenance. It's looked like villa you'd see on horror movies. The bed was so tough for your back, so many crack on the walls, the bathroom was really scary. But overall I enjoyed my stay.
review 4: We've stayed here many times over 18 years (only because of the cool weather, large rooms and lawns where kids can play). View is nice. Other than that it's smelly, urine smell in some rooms (not sure if they allow pets here or not), mildewy, very dated, unkept, light bulbs burned out, furniture broken, termites dropping from the grass ceiling, upholstery and curtains 15+ years old. Description is not correct: no pool, no hot tub, no Wi-Fi, no food served here. Gardens unkept and every year dying more and more.
review 5: Its not fancy but cosy! great hot bath fresh air its old but its good! fire palce is fun wish they would finish the pool not that u would swim because its cold fun place to stay üòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄ

name: Strawberry Petik Sendiri
address: Jl. Pancasari - Baturiti No.54, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia

name: Tepi Buyan (Babi Genyol & Ayam Betutu)
address: Jl. Pancasari - Baturiti, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia
review 1: Good food but a lot of flies from the farm below
review 2:
This place saved the day. Surprisingly nice local food that satisfy the tastebuds and stomach.

It had been rainy all day and most of the cafes and small restaurants were closed! This place was still opened. The servers were quick to ask if I wanted chicken, pork or both (mix).

I ordered both for take away (bungkus).
review 3:
The place where I stay , which is bedugul definitely has limited food option. By 4 PM most of the restaurant already close. Too far to go to singaraja (1 hours up the hills) , too far going to ubud especially with traffic.
Even when I came to tepi Buyan which is around 4.45PM , they are about to close.

Not my first option to eat bigul or nasi campur bali, but tepi buyan is the only one open.
Glad though we decided to give a try.
They had the nasi mix pork and chicken, or just pork or just chicken.
Portion are big enough, price very cheap (IDR 25k). Include soup with 1 cut of pork meat.
Love the baby genyol, soggy juicy texture kinda bland, but okay.
Chicken also taste good.
Not so much for the satay though.
Overall, If I ever stay around here again, tepi buyan would be my choice
review 4:
Great place
Good food

They have pancake, pisang goreng & gula aren, pisang bakar, nasi campur with chicken/pork/both, fried noodle, soup noodle...
(Instant noodles with extra veggies, spices, and seasonings)

Drinks:
Tea, Bali coffee, instant/sachet drinks.
review 5: Lunch with a view. Authentic Balinese food of pork and chicken available here. The best view you can get with a good price. Good staff. Overall good value.

name: Waroeng Buyan 818
address: Jl. Raya Singaraja-Denpasar, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia
review 1: this place is UNDERRATED i swear! food was unbelievably good and so worth the price - my boyfriend and i just randomly stopped by this restaurant on our way back from the waterfalls, and omg we genuinely wished it was closer to the city, we would've eaten here everyday! the view was amazing too, overlooking a rice terrace, though we couldn't sit outside bc of the rain
review 2: Great service. Staff singing along to the music playing. Great food. Highly recommend.
review 3: Unfortunately, pizza wasn't available, so we opted for carbonara and chicken dishes, along with a vegetable soup. The food we received was of excellent quality and we thoroughly enjoyed it. However, it's worth noting that there is no Wi-Fi available on the rooftop, which was a bit of a downside for us. Additionally, it's important to mention that the tips and taxes were not included in the price, which I don‚Äôt like.
review 4:
Meal quality on 4 stars. Fish was very small with lots of small bones and too spicy. Rice was no spicy and no salt at all. Springrolls was very dry.
Coffee was good.

Toilet is very dirty in this cafe. Prices are rather low, so you can have a budget lunch or dinner.
review 5: Lovely tasty food. Just that they didn't serve enough of sambal. Chicken and fish dishes were super good

name: Rumah Makan Lestari Babi Guling
address: Jl. Pancasari - Baturiti, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia
review 1: One of the best babi guling in Bedugul area. Really amazing and the lady is really nice
review 2: Great food at reasonable prices. I stop here often to get lunch or dinner. The owner is really sweet.
review 3:
It is a nice Warung to eat the Babi guling. I really enjoyed the soup.
Service is fast and the ladies are nice.
review 4:
I went here because it is nearby Pura Ulun Danu. Price is super affordable only 25k. Taste was ok 4 out of 5
Still worth to try!
review 5: Great pork rice/babi guling with hot pork soup, delicious and affordable price. Highly recommended ü§©

name: Ack pancasari
address: Q522+XM9, Pancasari, Sukasada, Buleleng Regency, Bali 81161, Indonesia

name: Warung muslim 2
address: Jl. Raya Singaraja-Denpasar, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali, Indonesia

name: Green Lake Cabin
address: Q43W+XM6, Pancasari, Sukasada, Buleleng Regency, Bali, Indonesia

name: Pondok Sania's Bedugul
address: Q44X+C55, Pancasari, Sukasada, Buleleng Regency, Bali 81161, Indonesia
review 1:
House in a very bad condition. Everything in mold, smell is awfull. No water at all!
Worst place I visited for 3 years in Bali. It is shame and disrecpectful attitude for the guests to rent such a place for 500k per night. We couldn't stay there, but booking was non-refundable so we lost money.

Do not go there!
review 2: Quite places with beautiful sunset views near buyan lake

name: Oemah Gusti
address: Q43X+7RH, Jl. Kedasong, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia
review 1: My wife and I stayed for one night in this peaceful place. The owner was very kind and helpful. He drop us off to a Bedugul restaurant and Bedugul Botanical Garden for free. I recommand strongly. You can enjoy by feet the 2 lakes and the botanical garden.
review 2:
- Small comfortable rooms with net above the bed
- 2 big Shared bathrooms on the ground floor ; one of them with hot water
- big land area
- parking
- WiFi is not so good
- shared kitchen with nice place to see sunrise

name: bedugulcamping
address: Jl. Raya Singaraja-Denpasar, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 82191, Indonesia
review 1: Great experience. We enjoyed a campfire at night and the beauty of the still Lake in the morning. The toilets are not great, but they were sufficient for camping. Also, adding the breakfast is worth the cost. The portions were generous and the food was tasty. Especially the homemade strawberry jam.

name: Ngopi yuk
address: Jl. Pancasari - Baturiti No.54, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia

name: Rumah Makan Mutiara Syobak & Nasi Campur
address: Pancasari, Sukasada, Buleleng Regency, Bali 81161, Indonesia
review 1: Expensive not tasty, little, saw that I was white and the price became higher

name: Warung BABI GULING BU EKA

review 1:
Nice place and calm to relax with family, staff is friendly and helpful
